Welcome to app_fastAPI’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

async main.healthchecker(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Health checker endpoint. Checks database connection status.

Parameters:

db – AsyncSession instance for database interaction.

Returns:

Health status message.

main.index()¶

Home endpoint. Returns a welcome message.

async main.startup()¶

Startup event handler. Initialize Redis connection and FastAPILimiter.

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactBase, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

Create a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – Data representing the new contact.

  • db – AsyncSession instance for database interaction.

  • user – User object representing the owner of the contact.

Returns:

The newly created Contact object.

async src.repository.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

Delete a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – The ID of the contact to delete.

  • db – AsyncSession instance for database interaction.

  • user – User object representing the owner of the contact.

Returns:

The deleted Contact object, if found and deleted.

async src.repository.contacts.get_all_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, db: AsyncSession)¶

Retrieve all contacts from the database.

Parameters:

  • limit – The maximum number of contacts to retrieve.

  • offset – The number of contacts to skip.

  • db – AsyncSession instance for database interaction.

Returns:

A list of all Contact objects.

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession) → Contact¶

Retrieve a specific contact by its ID from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • db – AsyncSession instance for database interaction.

Returns:

The Contact object corresponding to the given ID, if found.

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

Retrieve a list of contacts for a specific user from the database.

Parameters:

  • limit – The maximum number of contacts to retrieve.

  • offset – The number of contacts to skip.

  • db – AsyncSession instance for database interaction.

  • user – User object representing the owner of the contacts.

Returns:

A list of Contact objects.

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts_upcoming_birthdays(db: AsyncSession) → Sequence[Contact]¶

Retrieve contacts with upcoming birthdays within the next week.

Parameters:

db – AsyncSession instance for database interaction.

Returns:

A list of Contact objects with birthdays within the next week.

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactBase, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

Update an existing contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – The ID of the contact to update.

  • body – Data representing the updated contact information.

  • db – AsyncSession instance for database interaction.

  • user – User object representing the owner of the contact.

Returns:

The updated Contact object, if found and updated.

REST API repository Notes¶

async src.repository.notes.create_note(body: NoteModel, db: AsyncSession) → Note¶

Create a new note in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – Data representing the new note.

  • db – AsyncSession instance for database interaction.

Returns:

The newly created Note object.

async src.repository.notes.get_note(note_id: int, db: AsyncSession) → Note¶

Retrieve a specific note by its ID from the database.

Parameters:

  • note_id – The ID of the note to retrieve.

  • db – AsyncSession instance for database interaction.

Returns:

The Note object corresponding to the given ID, if found.

async src.repository.notes.get_notes(skip: int, offset: int, db: AsyncSession)¶

Retrieve a list of notes from the database.

Parameters:

  • skip – The number of notes to skip.

  • offset – The maximum number of notes to retrieve.

  • db – AsyncSession instance for database interaction.

Returns:

A list of Note objects.

async src.repository.notes.remove_note(note_id: int, db: AsyncSession) → Note | None¶

Remove a note from the database.

Parameters:

  • note_id – The ID of the note to remove.

  • db – AsyncSession instance for database interaction.

Returns:

The removed Note object, if found and deleted; otherwise, None.

async src.repository.notes.update_note(note_id: int, body: NoteUpdate, db: AsyncSession) → Note | None¶

Update an existing note in the database.

Parameters:

  • note_id – The ID of the note to update.

  • body – Data representing the updated note information.

  • db – AsyncSession instance for database interaction.

Returns:

The updated Note object, if found and updated; otherwise, None.

async src.repository.notes.update_status_note(note_id: int, body: NoteStatusUpdate, db: AsyncSession) → Note | None¶

Update the status (done or not done) of a note in the database.

Parameters:

  • note_id – The ID of the note to update.

  • body – Data representing the updated note status.

  • db – AsyncSession instance for database interaction.

Returns:

The updated Note object, if found and status updated; otherwise, None.

REST API repository Tags¶

async src.repository.tags.create_tag(body: TagModel, db: AsyncSession) → Tag¶

Create a new tag in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – Data representing the new tag.

  • db – AsyncSession instance for database interaction.

Returns:

Newly created Tag object.

async src.repository.tags.get_tag(tag_id: int, db: AsyncSession) → Tag¶

Retrieve a specific tag by its ID from the database.

Parameters:

  • tag_id – ID of the tag to retrieve.

  • db – AsyncSession instance for database interaction.

Returns:

Tag object corresponding to the given ID, if found.

async src.repository.tags.get_tags(skip: int, limit: int, db: AsyncSession)¶

Retrieve a list of tags from the database.

Parameters:

  • skip – Number of tags to skip.

  • limit – Maximum number of tags to retrieve.

  • db – AsyncSession instance for database interaction.

Returns:

List of Tag objects.

async src.repository.tags.remove_tag(tag_id: int, db: AsyncSession) → Tag | None¶

Remove a tag from the database.

Parameters:

  • tag_id – ID of the tag to remove.

  • db – AsyncSession instance for database interaction.

Returns:

Removed Tag object, if found and deleted; otherwise, None.

async src.repository.tags.update_tag(tag_id: int, body: TagModel, db: AsyncSession) → Tag | None¶

Update an existing tag in the database.

Parameters:

  • tag_id – ID of the tag to update.

  • body – Data representing the updated tag information.

  • db – AsyncSession instance for database interaction.

Returns:

Updated Tag object, if found and updated; otherwise, None.

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession) → None¶

Confirm the email address of a user in the database.

Parameters:

  • email – The email address of the user to confirm.

  • db – AsyncSession instance for database interaction.

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserSchema, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Create a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – Data representing the new user.

  • db – AsyncSession instance for database interaction.

Returns:

The newly created User object.

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Retrieve a user by their email address from the database.

Parameters:

  • email – The email address of the user to retrieve.

  • db – AsyncSession instance for database interaction.

Returns:

The User object corresponding to the given email, if found; otherwise, None.

async src.repository.users.update_avatar_url(email: str, url: str | None, db: AsyncSession) → User¶

Update the avatar URL of a user in the database.

Parameters:

  • email – The email address of the user to update.

  • url – The new avatar URL (or None to remove the avatar).

  • db – AsyncSession instance for database interaction.

Returns:

The updated User object.

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: AsyncSession)¶

Update the refresh token of a user in the database.

Parameters:

  • user – The User object to update.

  • token – The new refresh token value (or None to clear the token).

  • db – AsyncSession instance for database interaction.

REST API routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactBase, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Create a new contact.

Parameters:

  • body – Data representing the new contact.

  • db – AsyncSession instance for database interaction.

  • user – Current authenticated user.

Returns:

Newly created ContactResponse object.

async src.routes.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Delete a contact by ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – ID of the contact to delete (must be greater than or equal to 1).

  • db – AsyncSession instance for database interaction.

  • user – Current authenticated user.

Returns:

Deleted ContactResponse object.

async src.routes.contacts.get_all_contacts(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Retrieve all contacts without user filtering.

Parameters:

  • limit – Maximum number of contacts to retrieve (between 10 and 500).

  • offset – Number of contacts to skip.

  • db – AsyncSession instance for database interaction.

Returns:

List of ContactResponse objects.

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Retrieve a specific contact by ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – ID of the contact to retrieve (must be greater than or equal to 1).

  • db – AsyncSession instance for database interaction.

  • user – Current authenticated user.

Returns:

ContactResponse object.

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Retrieve a list of contacts.

Parameters:

  • limit – Maximum number of contacts to retrieve (between 10 and 500).

  • offset – Number of contacts to skip.

  • db – AsyncSession instance for database interaction.

  • user – Current authenticated user.

Returns:

List of ContactResponse objects.

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactUpdate, contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Update an existing contact by ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – ID of the contact to update (must be greater than or equal to 1).

  • body – Data representing the updated contact information.

  • db – AsyncSession instance for database interaction.

  • user – Current authenticated user.

Returns:

Updated ContactResponse object.

REST API routes Notes¶

async src.routes.notes.create_note(body: NoteModel, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Create a new note.

Parameters:

  • body – Data representing the new note.

  • db – AsyncSession instance for database interaction.

  • user – Current authenticated user.

Returns:

Newly created NoteResponse object.

async src.routes.notes.read_note(note_id: int, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Retrieve a specific note by ID.

Parameters:

  • note_id – ID of the note to retrieve.

  • db – AsyncSession instance for database interaction.

  • user – Current authenticated user.

Returns:

NoteResponse object.

async src.routes.notes.read_notes(skip: int = 0, limit: int = 100, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Retrieve a list of notes.

Parameters:

  • skip – Number of notes to skip.

  • limit – Maximum number of notes to retrieve.

  • db – AsyncSession instance for database interaction.

  • user – Current authenticated user.

Returns:

List of NoteResponse objects.

async src.routes.notes.remove_note(note_id: int, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Delete a note by ID.

Parameters:

  • note_id – ID of the note to delete.

  • db – AsyncSession instance for database interaction.

  • user – Current authenticated user.

Returns:

Deleted NoteResponse object.

async src.routes.notes.update_note(body: NoteUpdate, note_id: int, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Update an existing note by ID.

Parameters:

  • note_id – ID of the note to update.

  • body – Data representing the updated note information.

  • db – AsyncSession instance for database interaction.

  • user – Current authenticated user.

Returns:

Updated NoteResponse object.

async src.routes.notes.update_status_note(body: NoteStatusUpdate, note_id: int, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Update the status of a note by ID.

Parameters:

  • note_id – ID of the note to update.

  • body – Data representing the updated note status.

  • db – AsyncSession instance for database interaction.

  • user – Current authenticated user.

Returns:

Updated NoteResponse object.

REST API routes Tags¶

async src.routes.tags.create_tag(body: TagModel, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Create a new tag.

Parameters:

  • body – Data representing the new tag.

  • db – AsyncSession instance for database interaction.

  • user – Current authenticated user.

Returns:

Newly created TagResponse object.

async src.routes.tags.read_tag(tag_id: int, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Retrieve a specific tag by ID.

Parameters:

  • tag_id – ID of the tag to retrieve.

  • db – AsyncSession instance for database interaction.

  • user – Current authenticated user.

Returns:

TagResponse object.

async src.routes.tags.read_tags(skip: int = 0, limit: int = 100, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Retrieve a list of tags.

Parameters:

  • skip – Number of tags to skip.

  • limit – Maximum number of tags to retrieve.

  • db – AsyncSession instance for database interaction.

  • user – Current authenticated user.

Returns:

List of TagResponse objects.

async src.routes.tags.remove_tag(tag_id: int, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Delete a tag by ID.

Parameters:

  • tag_id – ID of the tag to delete.

  • db – AsyncSession instance for database interaction.

  • user – Current authenticated user.

Returns:

Deleted TagResponse object.

async src.routes.tags.update_tag(body: TagModel, tag_id: int, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Update an existing tag by ID.

Parameters:

  • tag_id – ID of the tag to update.

  • body – Data representing the updated tag information.

  • db – AsyncSession instance for database interaction.

  • user – Current authenticated user.

Returns:

Updated TagResponse object.

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.get_current_user(file: UploadFile, user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Update the avatar of the authenticated user.

This endpoint allows the authenticated user to update their avatar by uploading a new image file.

Parameters:

  • file – Uploaded image file for the new avatar.

  • user – Current authenticated user.

  • db – AsyncSession instance for database interaction.

Returns:

Updated UserResponse object with the new avatar URL.

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Confirm user’s email address.

Parameters:

  • token – Verification token.

  • db – AsyncSession instance for database interaction.

Returns:

Success message if email is confirmed.

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Log in a user and generate access tokens.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm containing login credentials.

  • db – AsyncSession instance for database interaction.

Returns:

TokenSchema containing access_token and refresh_token.

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Depends(HTTPBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Refresh access_token using refresh_token.

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials containing refresh_token.

  • db – AsyncSession instance for database interaction.

Returns:

TokenSchema containing refreshed access_token and new refresh_token.

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Request email confirmation.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail containing email address.

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks to run email sending asynchronously.

  • request – Request object to retrieve base URL.

  • db – AsyncSession instance for database interaction.

Returns:

Success message if email is requested for confirmation.

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserSchema, bt: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

Register a new user.

Parameters:

  • body – Data representing the new user.

  • bt – BackgroundTasks to run email sending asynchronously.

  • request – Request object to retrieve base URL.

  • db – AsyncSession instance for database interaction.

Returns:

Newly created UserResponse object.
